events.name: Dismissal of Germany's Cybersecurity Chief
events.wd_description: Germany's cybersecurity chief, Arne Schönbohm, was fired after allegations surfaced of his connections to a firm linked to Russian security circles, following a satirical TV show revelation.
events.description: Germany's cybersecurity chief, Arne Schönbohm, was fired after allegations surfaced of his connections to a firm linked to Russian security circles, following a satirical TV show revelation.

events.name: Dismissal of Schönbohm
events.wd_description: Arne Schönbohm, head of the German Federal Office for Information, was relieved of his duties as the country’s cybersecurity chief following allegations of ties to a Russian-linked firm.
events.description: Arne Schönbohm, head of the German Federal Office for Information, was relieved of his duties as the country’s cybersecurity chief following allegations of ties to a Russian-linked firm.

events.name: Allegations of Russian Connections
events.wd_description: Schönbohm's dismissal came after reports of his past connections to a Russian-linked cybersecurity firm, highlighted by a German satire show.
events.description: Schönbohm's dismissal came after reports of his past connections to a Russian-linked cybersecurity firm, highlighted by a German satire show.

events.name: Public Scrutiny
events.wd_description: The controversy surrounding Schönbohm's connections was brought to public attention by a satire show hosted by German comedian Jan Böhmermann, leading to increased scrutiny.
events.description: The controversy surrounding Schönbohm's connections was brought to public attention by a satire show hosted by German comedian Jan Böhmermann, leading to increased scrutiny.

events.name: Designation of Ibrahim Traore as Transitional President of Burkina Faso
events.wd_label: Designation of Ibrahim Traore as Transitional President of Burkina Faso
events.wd_description: Army captain Ibrahim Traore was officially designated as Burkina Faso's transitional President, following a coup he led, with plans to return the country to constitutional rule by 2024.
events.description: Army captain Ibrahim Traore was officially designated as Burkina Faso's transitional President, following a coup he led, with plans to return the country to constitutional rule by 2024.

events.name: Designation of Traore
events.wd_description: Army captain Ibrahim Traore was officially named the transitional President of Burkina Faso, following the second coup in the country this year.
events.description: Army captain Ibrahim Traore was officially named the transitional President of Burkina Faso, following the second coup in the country this year.

events.name: Transitional Government Plans
events.wd_description: Around 300 officials in Ouagadougou discussed plans to return Burkina Faso to constitutional rule by July 2024, as agreed with ECOWAS.
events.description: Around 300 officials in Ouagadougou discussed plans to return Burkina Faso to constitutional rule by July 2024, as agreed with ECOWAS.

events.name: Ongoing Insurgency
events.wd_description: Burkina Faso continues to battle a violent insurgency linked to Al Qaeda and Islamic State, which has caused thousands of deaths and nearly two million displacements.
events.description: Burkina Faso continues to battle a violent insurgency linked to Al Qaeda and Islamic State, which has caused thousands of deaths and nearly two million displacements.

events.name: Russia Suspends Participation in UN-Brokered Grain Export Deal
events.wd_label: Russia Suspends Participation in UN-Brokered Grain Export Deal
events.wd_description: Russia announced the suspension of its participation in the UN-brokered grain export deal with Ukraine after a drone attack on Sevastopol, Crimea, which Russia blames on Kyiv.
events.description: Russia announced the suspension of its participation in the UN-brokered grain export deal with Ukraine after a drone attack on Sevastopol, Crimea, which Russia blames on Kyiv.

events.name: Suspension of Grain Deal
events.wd_description: Russia suspended its involvement in the UN-brokered grain export deal with Ukraine, citing a drone attack on Sevastopol as the reason for its withdrawal.
events.description: Russia suspended its involvement in the UN-brokered grain export deal with Ukraine, citing a drone attack on Sevastopol as the reason for its withdrawal.

events.name: Drone Attack on Sevastopol
events.wd_description: A drone attack targeted the Crimean city of Sevastopol, which Russia attributed to Kyiv, although this claim could not be independently verified.
events.description: A drone attack targeted the Crimean city of Sevastopol, which Russia attributed to Kyiv, although this claim could not be independently verified.

events.name: Ukrainian Response
events.wd_description: Ukraine accused Russia of fabricating the attack to justify its withdrawal from the grain deal and criticized Moscow for various forms of blackmail, including nuclear and food blackmail.
events.description: Ukraine accused Russia of fabricating the attack to justify its withdrawal from the grain deal and criticized Moscow for various forms of blackmail, including nuclear and food blackmail.

events.name: Stellantis Secures Raw Materials for EV Batteries
events.wd_label: Stellantis Secures Raw Materials for EV Batteries
events.wd_description: Stellantis has signed a memorandum of understanding with GME Resources Limited to secure raw materials, including nickel and cobalt, needed for EV battery production, aiming to meet its decarbonization and EV production targets.
events.description: Stellantis has signed a memorandum of understanding with GME Resources Limited to secure raw materials, including nickel and cobalt, needed for EV battery production, aiming to meet its decarbonization and EV production targets.

events.name: Agreement with GME Resources
events.wd_description: Stellantis and GME Resources Limited have agreed on the future sale of battery-grade nickel and cobalt sulphate products from the NiWest Nickel-Cobalt Project in western Australia.
events.description: Stellantis and GME Resources Limited have agreed on the future sale of battery-grade nickel and cobalt sulphate products from the NiWest Nickel-Cobalt Project in western Australia.

events.name: Industry-Wide Efforts to Secure Raw Materials
events.wd_label: Industry-Wide Efforts to Secure Raw Materials
events.wd_description: Automakers, including Stellantis, GM, and Ford, are securing raw materials for EV batteries in response to government policies and growing consumer demand for electric vehicles.
events.description: Automakers, including Stellantis, GM, and Ford, are securing raw materials for EV batteries in response to government policies and growing consumer demand for electric vehicles.
